item.title: Is calculating really the point?
item.description: After taking a physics and math class concurrently this semester, I noticed a contrast whenever I was doing homework for each class: The math required for physics was way simpler than anything I was doing in math class, but the problems seemed much more difficult. When I compared how I was doing the problems for each class, I found that there was a particular step that I was skipping for my math problems, but not for physics: Converting the problem from its description to a series of smaller math problems, which I could then solve for the value I was looking for.
